favorites.title: Shingeki no Kyojin
favorites.synopsis:
Centuries ago, mankind was slaughtered to near extinction by monstrous humanoid creatures called Titans, forcing humans to hide in fear behind enormous concentric walls. What makes these giants truly terrifying is that their taste for human flesh is not born out of hunger but what appears to be out of pleasure. To ensure their survival, the remnants of humanity began living within defensive barriers, resulting in one hundred years without a single titan encounter. However, that fragile calm is soon shattered when a colossal Titan manages to breach the supposedly impregnable outer wall, reigniting the fight for survival against the man-eating abominations.

After witnessing a horrific personal loss at the hands of the invading creatures, Eren Yeager dedicates his life to their eradication by enlisting into the Survey Corps, an elite military unit that combats the merciless humanoids outside the protection of the walls. Eren, his adopted sister Mikasa Ackerman, and his childhood friend Armin Arlert join the brutal war against the Titans and race to discover a way of defeating them before the last walls are breached.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
favorites.background: Shingeki no Kyojin adapts content from the first eight volumes of Hajime Isayama's award-winning manga of the same name. The last episode received a pre-airing in Tokyo, Marunouchi Piccadilly 1 theater on Saturday, September 28, 2013. TV broadcast took place after midnight, a few hours later. Shingeki no Kyojin won the Animation of the Year in the Television category at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014.

favorites.title: Death Note
favorites.synopsis:
Brutal murders, petty thefts, and senseless violence pollute the human world. In contrast, the realm of death gods is a humdrum, unchanging gambling den. The ingenious 17-year-old Japanese student Light Yagami and sadistic god of death Ryuk share one belief: their worlds are rotten.

For his own amusement, Ryuk drops his Death Note into the human world. Light stumbles upon it, deeming the first of its rules ridiculous: the human whose name is written in this note shall die. However, the temptation is too great, and Light experiments by writing a felon's name, which disturbingly enacts his first murder.

Aware of the terrifying godlike power that has fallen into his hands, Light—under the alias Kira—follows his wicked sense of justice with the ultimate goal of cleansing the world of all evil-doers. The meticulous mastermind detective L is already on his trail, but as Light's brilliance rivals L's, the grand chase for Kira turns into an intense battle of wits that can only end when one of them is dead.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
favorites.background: Death Note has been adapted into live action films, TV dramas, video games, light novels and a musical composed by a Broadway composer. It is licensed in North America by Viz Media.

titles.title: 鋼の錬金術師 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST

favorites.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood
favorites.title_japanese: 鋼の錬金術師 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST
favorites.synopsis:
After a horrific alchemy experiment goes wrong in the Elric household, brothers Edward and Alphonse are left in a catastrophic new reality. Ignoring the alchemical principle banning human transmutation, the boys attempted to bring their recently deceased mother back to life. Instead, they suffered brutal personal loss: Alphonse's body disintegrated while Edward lost a leg and then sacrificed an arm to keep Alphonse's soul in the physical realm by binding it to a hulking suit of armor.

The brothers are rescued by their neighbor Pinako Rockbell and her granddaughter Winry. Known as a bio-mechanical engineering prodigy, Winry creates prosthetic limbs for Edward by utilizing "automail," a tough, versatile metal used in robots and combat armor. After years of training, the Elric brothers set off on a quest to restore their bodies by locating the Philosopher's Stone—a powerful gem that allows an alchemist to defy the traditional laws of Equivalent Exchange.

As Edward becomes an infamous alchemist and gains the nickname "Fullmetal," the boys' journey embroils them in a growing conspiracy that threatens the fate of the world.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

favorites.title: One Punch Man
favorites.synopsis:
The seemingly unimpressive Saitama has a rather unique hobby: being a hero. In order to pursue his childhood dream, Saitama relentlessly trained for three years, losing all of his hair in the process. Now, Saitama is so powerful, he can defeat any enemy with just one punch. However, having no one capable of matching his strength has led Saitama to an unexpected problem—he is no longer able to enjoy the thrill of battling and has become quite bored.

One day, Saitama catches the attention of 19-year-old cyborg Genos, who witnesses his power and wishes to become Saitama's disciple. Genos proposes that the two join the Hero Association in order to become certified heroes that will be recognized for their positive contributions to society. Saitama, who is shocked that no one knows who he is, quickly agrees. Meeting new allies and taking on new foes, Saitama embarks on a new journey as a member of the Hero Association to experience the excitement of battle he once felt.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
favorites.background: Episodes 1 and 2 were previewed at a screening in Saitama city cultural center (small hall) on September 6, 2015. Regular broadcasting began on October 5, 2015. One Punch Man is based on Yusuke Murata's manga remake of ONE's original web comic. The anime adapts the first seven volumes of the manga.

titles.title: ソードアート・オンライン

favorites.title: Sword Art Online
favorites.title_japanese: ソードアート・オンライン
favorites.synopsis:
Ever since the release of the innovative NerveGear, gamers from all around the globe have been given the opportunity to experience a completely immersive virtual reality. Sword Art Online (SAO), one of the most recent games on the console, offers a gateway into the wondrous world of Aincrad, a vivid, medieval landscape where users can do anything within the limits of imagination. With the release of this worldwide sensation, gaming has never felt more lifelike.

However, the idyllic fantasy rapidly becomes a brutal nightmare when SAO's creator traps thousands of players inside the game. The "log-out" function has been removed, with the only method of escape involving beating all of Aincrad's one hundred increasingly difficult levels. Adding to the struggle, any in-game death becomes permanent, ending the player's life in the real world.

While Kazuto "Kirito" Kirigaya was fortunate enough to be a beta-tester for the game, he quickly finds that despite his advantages, he cannot overcome SAO's challenges alone. Teaming up with Asuna Yuuki and other talented players, Kirito makes an effort to face the seemingly insurmountable trials head-on. But with difficult bosses and threatening dark cults impeding his progress, Kirito finds that such tasks are much easier said than done.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

newFanFic.name: Saitama: The Car Salesman
newFanFic.creator: Michael Jackson
newFanFic.title: One Punch Man
newFanFic.fanficBody:
Saitama, the unbeatable hero known as One Punch Man, was facing a new challenge. It wasn't a monstrous villain or a city-threatening disaster, but rather the mundane world of car sales. After saving countless lives and growing bored with his daily routine, Saitama decided it was time for a change. He wanted to apply his strength and wit in a different way, and what better way than becoming a car salesman?

Saitama strolled confidently into the sleek and modern showroom of "Speed Demon Auto Sales." The moment he stepped through the doors, all eyes turned to him. The sales team, dressed in sharp suits and ties, regarded him with curiosity and a hint of skepticism. Saitama, however, remained unfazed.

The manager, Mr. Johnson, approached Saitama cautiously. "Ah, you must be the new recruit," he said, eyeing Saitama's bald head and yellow jumpsuit. "We weren't expecting someone with your... unique style. But if you're serious about this, I suppose we can give you a chance."

Saitama simply nodded, his calm expression never wavering. He understood that appearances could be deceiving, and he was determined to prove his worth in the world of car sales.

For weeks, Saitama immersed himself in the intricacies of automobile knowledge. He devoured every piece of information about the latest models, engine specifications, and pricing details. His ability to absorb and retain information astounded his colleagues, who soon began to view him in a new light.

On his first day on the showroom floor, Saitama approached a potential customer browsing the selection of sedans. The man, a tech-savvy individual with discerning taste, scrutinized every detail of the vehicles. Saitama approached him with a warm smile.

"Looking for a car that matches your style, sir?" Saitama asked, his voice calm and reassuring.

The man raised an eyebrow. "And what makes you think you can help me?"

Saitama leaned against one of the sleek cars, nonchalantly flexing his bicep. "Well, you see, I've faced opponents much tougher than any car on this lot. I know power when I see it. Let me show you something special."

Intrigued, the man followed Saitama to a hidden corner of the showroom. There, covered in a white cloth, stood an unassuming hatchback. Saitama dramatically unveiled it, revealing a shining red sports car underneath.

"This," Saitama said with a grin, "is the Speed Demon GT. It may not look like much, but trust me when I say it packs a punch."

He revved the engine, and the sports car came to life with a roar. The customer's eyes widened with excitement. Saitama continued to showcase the car's features, effortlessly addressing every question and concern the man had.

In no time, the customer was sold. He couldn't resist the allure of the Speed Demon GT's power and sleek design. Saitama had done the impossible - he had made a sale on his very first try.

Word of Saitama's uncanny talent quickly spread throughout the dealership. The other salespeople marveled at his ability to connect with customers, using his experiences as a hero to highlight the unique aspects of each car. Saitama's sales figures skyrocketed, making him the top performer in the entire dealership.

But Saitama remained humble, never losing sight of his goal to bring joy to people's lives, whether it be through saving them from disaster or helping them find their dream car. He had discovered a new passion, one that allowed him to use his strength and knowledge in unexpected ways.

newFanFic.name: Light Yagami Passed Out on the Couch
newFanFic.creator: Kwame B.
newFanFic.title: Death Note
newFanFic.fanficBody:
Light Yagami, the brilliant and cunning protagonist of Death Note, had spent yet another intense night plotting his next move as Kira. The weight of his actions and the pressure of maintaining his double life as a high school student and a god-like vigilante had begun to take its toll on him. As the night drew to a close, exhaustion finally caught up with Light, and he found himself succumbing to an overwhelming sleepiness.

With heavy eyelids, Light stumbled his way into the living room, collapsing onto the plush couch. The soft cushions embraced him, providing a sense of comfort he hadn't felt in a long time. His body sank into the cozy depths, and he let out a contented sigh, feeling the stress slowly melt away.

Wrapped in the serenity of the room, Light's eyes fluttered shut. The weight of the Death Note, the weapon that granted him his powers, rested beside him on the coffee table, a constant reminder of the responsibility he carried. But for now, he allowed himself to surrender to the gentle embrace of sleep.

As his breathing deepened, Light's dreams took him to a realm far removed from the realm of justice and darkness he navigated every day. The world around him transformed into a serene landscape, with sunlight filtering through a canopy of trees, casting a gentle glow upon the grassy fields. Birds chirped melodiously in the distance, their harmonious songs lulling him deeper into his slumber.

In his dream, Light found himself standing on a calm shoreline, the waves lapping gently at his feet. He looked out at the horizon, where the colors of the setting sun painted the sky with a breathtaking palette. A peaceful calm washed over him as he admired the beauty of the scene, forgetting, even if just for a moment, the burden he carried.

Unbeknownst to Light, Ryuk, the Shinigami who had bestowed the Death Note upon him, watched from the shadows. The usually mischievous and enigmatic creature observed with curiosity as his human companion, the orchestrator of a complex game of life and death, finally found respite in slumber.

Light's features softened as he slept, his usually sharp and calculating eyes relaxed. A faint smile graced his lips, hinting at the innocence and vulnerability he rarely revealed in his waking hours. It was a sight that intrigued Ryuk, a reminder of the humanity that lay beneath Light's cold exterior.

The minutes turned into hours as Light's peaceful slumber continued. The room around him remained silent, the only sound being the soft hum of the air conditioner. Even as the world outside carried on, the weight of Kira's actions and the constant vigilance required to maintain his secret identity faded away, if only temporarily.

Eventually, the morning light filtered through the curtains, gently caressing Light's face. Slowly, he stirred from his deep sleep, stretching his arms above his head. His eyes opened, momentarily disoriented as he adjusted to his surroundings.

With a yawn, Light sat up on the couch, his gaze falling upon the Death Note resting on the coffee table. The weight of his responsibilities returned, and a determined glint appeared in his eyes once more. He had rested, rejuvenated, and now he would continue his mission to create a new world, no matter the cost.

But in the depths of his memories, the dream of a peaceful shoreline lingered. Light couldn't help but wonder if there might be a world where he could find solace, away from the darkness he had embraced. For now, though, he knew his path lay in the shadows, orchestrating the fate of humanity with the pen and the power of the Death Note.

newFanFic.name: Naruto: Dog Owner
newFanFic.creator: Ashay
newFanFic.title: Naruto
newFanFic.fanficBody:
Naruto Uzumaki, the spirited ninja of Konoha, had finally reached a point in his life where he felt ready for a new companion. As he strolled through the bustling streets of the village, a small sign caught his attention: "Paws and Tails Pet Store."

Curiosity piqued, Naruto followed the sign, entering the cozy pet shop with excitement radiating from his every pore. The store was filled with the sounds of barks and meows, a symphony of furry friends awaiting their forever homes.

As Naruto made his way through the aisles, he couldn't help but feel drawn to the section reserved for dogs. He saw puppies of various breeds and sizes, each vying for his attention with wagging tails and soulful eyes.

But one particular puppy caught Naruto's eye. It was a tiny Shiba Inu, its coat a beautiful shade of red, its ears perked up, and its eyes brimming with mischief. Naruto's heart melted as he watched the playful pup paw at the glass enclosure, seemingly pleading to be taken home.

Unable to resist, Naruto approached the store owner, a kind-hearted woman named Mrs. Hana, who had been observing him with a knowing smile.

"Hey, Mrs. Hana! How much for that Shiba Inu puppy?" Naruto asked eagerly.

Mrs. Hana chuckled and replied, "Ah, you have a good eye, Naruto. That's a special little pup right there. I call him Kurama. He's quite mischievous, but I think he'd be a perfect fit for someone as energetic as you. How about we discuss the adoption process?"

Naruto's eyes lit up with excitement. He couldn't wait to bring Kurama home and shower him with love and attention. After going through the necessary paperwork, Naruto held Kurama in his arms, the bond between them already forming.

Back in his small apartment, Naruto introduced Kurama to his new home. The energetic puppy immediately started exploring every nook and cranny, leaving no corner untouched. Naruto laughed, realizing he had his hands full with this spirited little companion.

Days turned into weeks, and Naruto and Kurama became inseparable. They spent hours training together, with Naruto teaching Kurama basic commands and the importance of teamwork. Kurama proved to be a quick learner, eager to please his beloved owner.

Outside of their training sessions, Naruto took Kurama on countless adventures around the village. The pair would run through the forests, play in the park, and even enjoy some of Ichiraku Ramen's famous bowls together. Naruto's friends admired the bond between the ninja and his dog, noting how they seemed to understand each other without the need for words.

But it wasn't all fun and games. Naruto soon realized that raising a puppy required patience, discipline, and plenty of chew toys. Kurama's mischievous nature often led him to mischief, like digging up Naruto's garden or stealing Ichiraku Ramen coupons. Still, Naruto couldn't stay mad for long, always finding himself laughing at Kurama's antics.

As the years passed, Naruto and Kurama's bond grew stronger. Kurama matured into a loyal and protective companion, always by Naruto's side. Through triumphs and trials, they faced the challenges of life together, relying on their unbreakable bond to see them through.

And so, Naruto Uzumaki, the spirited ninja with a heart of gold, found not only a lifelong friend but a faithful partner in Kurama. Their journey continued, side by side, as they embraced the adventures and obstacles that awaited them, ready to face whatever the ninja world had in store.
